analysis.core.data_structures¶

Source: src\analysis\core\data_structures.py

Module Overview¶

Data structures for analysis framework.

Advanced Mathematical Theory¶

Time Series Data Structures¶

Discrete-time signal:

\[x[n] \in \mathbb{R}^d, \quad n = 0, 1, \ldots, N-1\]

Sampling theorem:

\[f_s \geq 2f_{max} \quad \text{(Nyquist criterion)}\]

Circular Buffer¶

Fixed-size buffer with wraparound:

\[\text{index} = (\text{head} + i) \bmod N\]

Memory complexity: \(O(N)\), constant space.

Sliding Window¶

Window of size \(W\):

\[x_w[n] = [x[n-W+1], \ldots, x[n]]\]

Online mean update:

\[\mu_n = \mu_{n-1} + \frac{x[n] - x[n-W]}{W}\]

Sparse Matrix Storage¶

Compressed Sparse Row (CSR):

\[A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n} \to (\text{values}, \text{col_indices}, \text{row_ptr})\]

Memory: \(O(\text{nnz})\) vs \(O(mn)\) for dense.

Ring Buffer for Convolution¶

Circular convolution:

\[y[n] = \sum_{k=0}^{M-1} h[k] x[(n-k) \bmod N]\]

Priority Queue¶

Binary heap operations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \text{Insert: } & O(\log n) \\ \text{Extract-Min: } & O(\log n) \\ \text{Peek: } & O(1) \end{align}\end{split}\]

State Vector Storage¶

Full state history:

\[\mathbf{X} \in \mathbb{R}^{N \times d}, \quad X[i, :] = \vec{x}(t_i)\]

Memory: \(O(Nd)\) for \(N\) timesteps, \(d\) dimensions.

Downsampling Strategy¶

Decimation by factor \(M\):

\[y[n] = x[Mn], \quad n = 0, 1, \ldots, \lfloor N/M \rfloor - 1\]

Anti-aliasing filter before decimation to prevent aliasing.

Architecture Diagram¶

graph TD A[Data Stream] --> B{Storage Type} B -->|Bounded| C[Circular Buffer] B -->|Unbounded| D[Dynamic Array] B -->|Sparse| E[CSR Matrix] C --> F[Wraparound Index] F --> G[Constant Memory] D --> H[Resize Strategy] H --> I[Amortized O(1)] E --> J[Compressed Storage] J --> K[O(nnz) Memory] C --> L[Sliding Window] L --> M[Online Statistics] M --> N[Running Mean] M --> O[Running Variance] D --> P[Full History] P --> Q[Post-Processing] style B fill:#ff9 style G fill:#9f9 style K fill:#9f9

Usage Examples¶

Example 1: Basic Analysis¶

from src.analysis import Analyzer

# Initialize analyzer
analyzer = Analyzer(config)
result = analyzer.analyze(data)

Example 2: Statistical Validation¶

# Compute confidence intervals
from src.analysis.validation import compute_confidence_interval

ci = compute_confidence_interval(samples, confidence=0.95)
print(f"95% CI: [{ci.lower:.3f}, {ci.upper:.3f}]")

Example 3: Performance Metrics¶

# Compute comprehensive metrics
from src.analysis.performance import compute_all_metrics

metrics = compute_all_metrics(
    time=t,
    state=x,
    control=u,
    reference=r
)
print(f"ISE: {metrics.ise:.2f}, ITAE: {metrics.itae:.2f}")

Example 4: Batch Analysis¶

# Analyze multiple trials
results = []
for trial in range(n_trials):
    result = run_simulation(trial_seed=trial)
    results.append(analyzer.analyze(result))

# Aggregate statistics
mean_performance = np.mean([r.performance for r in results])

Example 5: Robustness Analysis¶

# Parameter sensitivity analysis
from src.analysis.performance import sensitivity_analysis

sensitivity = sensitivity_analysis(
    system=plant,
    parameters={'mass': (0.8, 1.2), 'length': (0.9, 1.1)},
    metric=compute_stability_margin
)
print(f"Most sensitive: {sensitivity.most_sensitive_param}")

This module provides standardized data structures for representing simulation data, analysis results, and configuration parameters.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#======================== src/analysis/core/data_structures.py ========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Data structures for analysis framework.
  6
  7This module provides standardized data structures for representing
  8simulation data, analysis results, and configuration parameters.
  9"""
 10
 11from __future__ import annotations
 12
 13from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 14from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
 15import numpy as np
 16from datetime import datetime
 17
 18from .interfaces import AnalysisResult, AnalysisStatus
 19
 20
 21@dataclass
 22class SimulationData:
 23    """Standard container for simulation data."""
 24    times: np.ndarray
 25    states: np.ndarray
 26    controls: np.ndarray
 27    reference: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
 28    disturbances: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
 29    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 30
 31    def __post_init__(self):
 32        """Validate data consistency after initialization."""
 33        self._validate_dimensions()
 34
 35    def _validate_dimensions(self) -> None:
 36        """Validate dimensional consistency of arrays."""
 37        n_time_steps = len(self.times)
 38
 39        if self.states.shape[0] != n_time_steps:
 40            raise ValueError(f"States array length {self.states.shape[0]} doesn't match times length {n_time_steps}")
 41
 42        if self.controls.shape[0] != n_time_steps - 1:  # Controls typically have one less sample
 43            if self.controls.shape[0] != n_time_steps:
 44                raise ValueError(f"Controls array length {self.controls.shape[0]} is incompatible with times length {n_time_steps}")
 45
 46    def get_time_range(self) -> Tuple[float, float]:
 47        """Get time range of the data."""
 48        return float(self.times[0]), float(self.times[-1])
 49
 50    def get_sampling_rate(self) -> float:
 51        """Get average sampling rate."""
 52        if len(self.times) < 2:
 53            return 0.0
 54        return float(1.0 / np.mean(np.diff(self.times)))
 55
 56    def get_duration(self) -> float:
 57        """Get total simulation duration."""
 58        return float(self.times[-1] - self.times[0])
 59
 60    def extract_slice(self, start_time: float, end_time: float) -> 'SimulationData':
 61        """Extract a time slice of the data."""
 62        mask = (self.times >= start_time) & (self.times <= end_time)
 63        indices = np.where(mask)[0]
 64
 65        if len(indices) == 0:
 66            raise ValueError(f"No data found in time range [{start_time}, {end_time}]")
 67
 68        start_idx, end_idx = indices[0], indices[-1] + 1
 69
 70        # Handle controls array dimension carefully
 71        control_end_idx = min(end_idx, len(self.controls))
 72
 73        return SimulationData(
 74            times=self.times[start_idx:end_idx],
 75            states=self.states[start_idx:end_idx],
 76            controls=self.controls[start_idx:control_end_idx],
 77            reference=self.reference[start_idx:end_idx] if self.reference is not None else None,
 78            disturbances=self.disturbances[start_idx:end_idx] if self.disturbances is not None else None,
 79            metadata=self.metadata.copy()
 80        )
 81
 82    def downsample(self, factor: int) -> 'SimulationData':
 83        """Downsample the data by the given factor."""
 84        if factor <= 1:
 85            return self
 86
 87        indices = np.arange(0, len(self.times), factor)
 88        control_indices = np.arange(0, len(self.controls), factor)
 89
 90        return SimulationData(
 91            times=self.times[indices],
 92            states=self.states[indices],
 93            controls=self.controls[control_indices],
 94            reference=self.reference[indices] if self.reference is not None else None,
 95            disturbances=self.disturbances[indices] if self.disturbances is not None else None,
 96            metadata=self.metadata.copy()
 97        )
 98
 99
100@dataclass
101class MetricResult:
102    """Container for individual metric results."""
103    name: str
104    value: float
105    unit: Optional[str] = None
106    description: Optional[str] = None
107    confidence_interval: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = None
108    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
109
110    def __str__(self) -> str:
111        """String representation of the metric."""
112        unit_str = f" {self.unit}" if self.unit else ""
113        ci_str = ""
114        if self.confidence_interval:
115            ci_str = f" [CI: {self.confidence_interval[0]:.3f}, {self.confidence_interval[1]:.3f}]"
116        return f"{self.name}: {self.value:.6f}{unit_str}{ci_str}"
117
118
119@dataclass
120class PerformanceMetrics:
121    """Container for performance metrics."""
122    metrics: List[MetricResult] = field(default_factory=list)
123    computation_time: Optional[float] = None
124    timestamp: datetime = field(default_factory=datetime.now)
125
126    def add_metric(self, metric: MetricResult) -> None:
127        """Add a metric to the collection."""
128        self.metrics.append(metric)
129
130    def get_metric(self, name: str) -> Optional[MetricResult]:
131        """Get a metric by name."""
132        for metric in self.metrics:
133            if metric.name == name:
134                return metric
135        return None
136
137    def get_metric_value(self, name: str) -> Optional[float]:
138        """Get a metric value by name."""
139        metric = self.get_metric(name)
140        return metric.value if metric else None
141
142    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
143        """Convert metrics to dictionary for compatibility."""
144        return {metric.name: metric.value for metric in self.metrics}
145
146    def summary_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
147        """Compute summary statistics of all metrics."""
148        values = [metric.value for metric in self.metrics]
149        if not values:
150            return {}
151
152        return {
153            'count': len(values),
154            'mean': np.mean(values),
155            'std': np.std(values),
156            'min': np.min(values),
157            'max': np.max(values),
158            'median': np.median(values)
159        }
160
161
162@dataclass
163class FaultDetectionResult:
164    """Container for fault detection results."""
165    status: str  # "OK", "FAULT", "WARNING"
166    fault_type: Optional[str] = None
167    confidence: Optional[float] = None
168    detection_time: Optional[float] = None
169    residual_history: List[float] = field(default_factory=list)
170    threshold_history: List[float] = field(default_factory=list)
171    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
172
173    def is_fault_detected(self) -> bool:
174        """Check if a fault was detected."""
175        return self.status == "FAULT"
176
177    def has_warnings(self) -> bool:
178        """Check if there are warnings."""
179        return self.status == "WARNING"
180
181
182@dataclass
183class StatisticalTestResult:
184    """Container for statistical test results."""
185    test_name: str
186    statistic: float
187    p_value: float
188    critical_value: Optional[float] = None
189    confidence_level: float = 0.95
190    conclusion: str = ""
191    effect_size: Optional[float] = None
192    power: Optional[float] = None
193
194    def is_significant(self, alpha: float = 0.05) -> bool:
195        """Check if result is statistically significant."""
196        return self.p_value < alpha
197
198    def __str__(self) -> str:
199        """String representation of test result."""
200        return (f"{self.test_name}: statistic={self.statistic:.4f}, "
201                f"p-value={self.p_value:.4f}, significant={self.is_significant()}")
202
203
204@dataclass
205class ConfidenceInterval:
206    """Container for confidence intervals."""
207    lower: float
208    upper: float
209    confidence_level: float
210    method: str = "t-distribution"
211
212    @property
213    def width(self) -> float:
214        """Width of the confidence interval."""
215        return self.upper - self.lower
216
217    @property
218    def center(self) -> float:
219        """Center of the confidence interval."""
220        return (self.lower + self.upper) / 2
221
222    def contains(self, value: float) -> bool:
223        """Check if value is within the confidence interval."""
224        return self.lower <= value <= self.upper
225
226    def __str__(self) -> str:
227        """String representation of confidence interval."""
228        return f"[{self.lower:.4f}, {self.upper:.4f}] ({self.confidence_level*100:.0f}% CI)"
229
230
231@dataclass
232class ComparisonResult:
233    """Container for comparison analysis results."""
234    method_a_name: str
235    method_b_name: str
236    metric_comparisons: Dict[str, StatisticalTestResult] = field(default_factory=dict)
237    effect_sizes: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
238    confidence_intervals: Dict[str, ConfidenceInterval] = field(default_factory=dict)
239    overall_conclusion: str = ""
240    recommendation: str = ""
241
242    def get_winner(self, metric: str, lower_is_better: bool = True) -> Optional[str]:
243        """Determine the winning method for a specific metric."""
244        if metric not in self.metric_comparisons:
245            return None
246
247        test_result = self.metric_comparisons[metric]
248        if not test_result.is_significant():
249            return "No significant difference"
250
251        # This would need to be implemented based on the specific test used
252        # For now, return a placeholder
253        return "Requires specific test interpretation"
254
255
256@dataclass
257class AnalysisConfiguration:
258    """Configuration for analysis operations."""
259    metrics_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
260    performance_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
261    fault_detection_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
262    validation_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
263    visualization_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
264
265    # Default configurations
266    def __post_init__(self):
267        """Set default configurations if not provided."""
268        if not self.metrics_config:
269            self.metrics_config = {
270                'include_basic_metrics': True,
271                'include_control_metrics': True,
272                'include_stability_metrics': False,
273                'time_window': None
274            }
275
276        if not self.performance_config:
277            self.performance_config = {
278                'reference_tracking_tolerance': 0.02,
279                'settling_time_criteria': 0.02,
280                'overshoot_threshold': 0.1
281            }
282
283        if not self.fault_detection_config:
284            self.fault_detection_config = {
285                'enable_adaptive_threshold': True,
286                'residual_threshold': 0.5,
287                'persistence_counter': 10
288            }
289
290        if not self.validation_config:
291            self.validation_config = {
292                'confidence_level': 0.95,
293                'bootstrap_samples': 1000,
294                'monte_carlo_runs': 30
295            }
296
297    def validate(self) -> bool:
298        """Validate configuration parameters."""
299        try:
300            # Validate confidence level
301            if not 0 < self.validation_config.get('confidence_level', 0.95) < 1:
302                return False
303
304            # Validate thresholds are positive
305            if self.fault_detection_config.get('residual_threshold', 0.5) <= 0:
306                return False
307
308            return True
309        except (KeyError, TypeError, ValueError):
310            return False
311
312
313# Utility functions for creating data structures
314def create_simulation_data_from_arrays(times: np.ndarray,
315                                     states: np.ndarray,
316                                     controls: np.ndarray,
317                                     **kwargs) -> SimulationData:
318    """Factory function for creating SimulationData."""
319    return SimulationData(
320        times=times,
321        states=states,
322        controls=controls,
323        reference=kwargs.get('reference'),
324        disturbances=kwargs.get('disturbances'),
325        metadata=kwargs.get('metadata', {})
326    )
327
328
329def create_analysis_result(status: AnalysisStatus,
330                         message: str,
331                         data: Dict[str, Any],
332                         **kwargs) -> AnalysisResult:
333    """Factory function for creating AnalysisResult."""
334    return AnalysisResult(
335        status=status,
336        message=message,
337        data=data,
338        timestamp=kwargs.get('timestamp'),
339        metadata=kwargs.get('metadata')
340    )

Classes¶

SimulationData¶

Standard container for simulation data.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class SimulationData:
 3    """Standard container for simulation data."""
 4    times: np.ndarray
 5    states: np.ndarray
 6    controls: np.ndarray
 7    reference: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
 8    disturbances: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
 9    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
10
11    def __post_init__(self):
12        """Validate data consistency after initialization."""
13        self._validate_dimensions()
14
15    def _validate_dimensions(self) -> None:
16        """Validate dimensional consistency of arrays."""
17        n_time_steps = len(self.times)
18
19        if self.states.shape[0] != n_time_steps:
20            raise ValueError(f"States array length {self.states.shape[0]} doesn't match times length {n_time_steps}")
21
22        if self.controls.shape[0] != n_time_steps - 1:  # Controls typically have one less sample
23            if self.controls.shape[0] != n_time_steps:
24                raise ValueError(f"Controls array length {self.controls.shape[0]} is incompatible with times length {n_time_steps}")
25
26    def get_time_range(self) -> Tuple[float, float]:
27        """Get time range of the data."""
28        return float(self.times[0]), float(self.times[-1])
29
30    def get_sampling_rate(self) -> float:
31        """Get average sampling rate."""
32        if len(self.times) < 2:
33            return 0.0
34        return float(1.0 / np.mean(np.diff(self.times)))
35
36    def get_duration(self) -> float:
37        """Get total simulation duration."""
38        return float(self.times[-1] - self.times[0])
39
40    def extract_slice(self, start_time: float, end_time: float) -> 'SimulationData':
41        """Extract a time slice of the data."""
42        mask = (self.times >= start_time) & (self.times <= end_time)
43        indices = np.where(mask)[0]
44
45        if len(indices) == 0:
46            raise ValueError(f"No data found in time range [{start_time}, {end_time}]")
47
48        start_idx, end_idx = indices[0], indices[-1] + 1
49
50        # Handle controls array dimension carefully
51        control_end_idx = min(end_idx, len(self.controls))
52
53        return SimulationData(
54            times=self.times[start_idx:end_idx],
55            states=self.states[start_idx:end_idx],
56            controls=self.controls[start_idx:control_end_idx],
57            reference=self.reference[start_idx:end_idx] if self.reference is not None else None,
58            disturbances=self.disturbances[start_idx:end_idx] if self.disturbances is not None else None,
59            metadata=self.metadata.copy()
60        )
61
62    def downsample(self, factor: int) -> 'SimulationData':
63        """Downsample the data by the given factor."""
64        if factor <= 1:
65            return self
66
67        indices = np.arange(0, len(self.times), factor)
68        control_indices = np.arange(0, len(self.controls), factor)
69
70        return SimulationData(
71            times=self.times[indices],
72            states=self.states[indices],
73            controls=self.controls[control_indices],
74            reference=self.reference[indices] if self.reference is not None else None,
75            disturbances=self.disturbances[indices] if self.disturbances is not None else None,
76            metadata=self.metadata.copy()
77        )

MetricResult¶

Container for individual metric results.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class MetricResult:
 3    """Container for individual metric results."""
 4    name: str
 5    value: float
 6    unit: Optional[str] = None
 7    description: Optional[str] = None
 8    confidence_interval: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = None
 9    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
10
11    def __str__(self) -> str:
12        """String representation of the metric."""
13        unit_str = f" {self.unit}" if self.unit else ""
14        ci_str = ""
15        if self.confidence_interval:
16            ci_str = f" [CI: {self.confidence_interval[0]:.3f}, {self.confidence_interval[1]:.3f}]"
17        return f"{self.name}: {self.value:.6f}{unit_str}{ci_str}"

PerformanceMetrics¶

Container for performance metrics.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class PerformanceMetrics:
 3    """Container for performance metrics."""
 4    metrics: List[MetricResult] = field(default_factory=list)
 5    computation_time: Optional[float] = None
 6    timestamp: datetime = field(default_factory=datetime.now)
 7
 8    def add_metric(self, metric: MetricResult) -> None:
 9        """Add a metric to the collection."""
10        self.metrics.append(metric)
11
12    def get_metric(self, name: str) -> Optional[MetricResult]:
13        """Get a metric by name."""
14        for metric in self.metrics:
15            if metric.name == name:
16                return metric
17        return None
18
19    def get_metric_value(self, name: str) -> Optional[float]:
20        """Get a metric value by name."""
21        metric = self.get_metric(name)
22        return metric.value if metric else None
23
24    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
25        """Convert metrics to dictionary for compatibility."""
26        return {metric.name: metric.value for metric in self.metrics}
27
28    def summary_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
29        """Compute summary statistics of all metrics."""
30        values = [metric.value for metric in self.metrics]
31        if not values:
32            return {}
33
34        return {
35            'count': len(values),
36            'mean': np.mean(values),
37            'std': np.std(values),
38            'min': np.min(values),
39            'max': np.max(values),
40            'median': np.median(values)
41        }

 1@dataclass
 2class FaultDetectionResult:
 3    """Container for fault detection results."""
 4    status: str  # "OK", "FAULT", "WARNING"
 5    fault_type: Optional[str] = None
 6    confidence: Optional[float] = None
 7    detection_time: Optional[float] = None
 8    residual_history: List[float] = field(default_factory=list)
 9    threshold_history: List[float] = field(default_factory=list)
10    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
11
12    def is_fault_detected(self) -> bool:
13        """Check if a fault was detected."""
14        return self.status == "FAULT"
15
16    def has_warnings(self) -> bool:
17        """Check if there are warnings."""
18        return self.status == "WARNING"

StatisticalTestResult¶

Container for statistical test results.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class StatisticalTestResult:
 3    """Container for statistical test results."""
 4    test_name: str
 5    statistic: float
 6    p_value: float
 7    critical_value: Optional[float] = None
 8    confidence_level: float = 0.95
 9    conclusion: str = ""
10    effect_size: Optional[float] = None
11    power: Optional[float] = None
12
13    def is_significant(self, alpha: float = 0.05) -> bool:
14        """Check if result is statistically significant."""
15        return self.p_value < alpha
16
17    def __str__(self) -> str:
18        """String representation of test result."""
19        return (f"{self.test_name}: statistic={self.statistic:.4f}, "
20                f"p-value={self.p_value:.4f}, significant={self.is_significant()}")

ConfidenceInterval¶

Container for confidence intervals.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class ConfidenceInterval:
 3    """Container for confidence intervals."""
 4    lower: float
 5    upper: float
 6    confidence_level: float
 7    method: str = "t-distribution"
 8
 9    @property
10    def width(self) -> float:
11        """Width of the confidence interval."""
12        return self.upper - self.lower
13
14    @property
15    def center(self) -> float:
16        """Center of the confidence interval."""
17        return (self.lower + self.upper) / 2
18
19    def contains(self, value: float) -> bool:
20        """Check if value is within the confidence interval."""
21        return self.lower <= value <= self.upper
22
23    def __str__(self) -> str:
24        """String representation of confidence interval."""
25        return f"[{self.lower:.4f}, {self.upper:.4f}] ({self.confidence_level*100:.0f}% CI)"

ComparisonResult¶

Container for comparison analysis results.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class ComparisonResult:
 3    """Container for comparison analysis results."""
 4    method_a_name: str
 5    method_b_name: str
 6    metric_comparisons: Dict[str, StatisticalTestResult] = field(default_factory=dict)
 7    effect_sizes: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
 8    confidence_intervals: Dict[str, ConfidenceInterval] = field(default_factory=dict)
 9    overall_conclusion: str = ""
10    recommendation: str = ""
11
12    def get_winner(self, metric: str, lower_is_better: bool = True) -> Optional[str]:
13        """Determine the winning method for a specific metric."""
14        if metric not in self.metric_comparisons:
15            return None
16
17        test_result = self.metric_comparisons[metric]
18        if not test_result.is_significant():
19            return "No significant difference"
20
21        # This would need to be implemented based on the specific test used
22        # For now, return a placeholder
23        return "Requires specific test interpretation"

AnalysisConfiguration¶

Configuration for analysis operations.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class AnalysisConfiguration:
 3    """Configuration for analysis operations."""
 4    metrics_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 5    performance_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 6    fault_detection_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 7    validation_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 8    visualization_config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 9
10    # Default configurations
11    def __post_init__(self):
12        """Set default configurations if not provided."""
13        if not self.metrics_config:
14            self.metrics_config = {
15                'include_basic_metrics': True,
16                'include_control_metrics': True,
17                'include_stability_metrics': False,
18                'time_window': None
19            }
20
21        if not self.performance_config:
22            self.performance_config = {
23                'reference_tracking_tolerance': 0.02,
24                'settling_time_criteria': 0.02,
25                'overshoot_threshold': 0.1
26            }
27
28        if not self.fault_detection_config:
29            self.fault_detection_config = {
30                'enable_adaptive_threshold': True,
31                'residual_threshold': 0.5,
32                'persistence_counter': 10
33            }
34
35        if not self.validation_config:
36            self.validation_config = {
37                'confidence_level': 0.95,
38                'bootstrap_samples': 1000,
39                'monte_carlo_runs': 30
40            }
41
42    def validate(self) -> bool:
43        """Validate configuration parameters."""
44        try:
45            # Validate confidence level
46            if not 0 < self.validation_config.get('confidence_level', 0.95) < 1:
47                return False
48
49            # Validate thresholds are positive
50            if self.fault_detection_config.get('residual_threshold', 0.5) <= 0:
51                return False
52
53            return True
54        except (KeyError, TypeError, ValueError):
55            return False

Factory function for creating SimulationData.

Source Code¶

 1def create_simulation_data_from_arrays(times: np.ndarray,
 2                                     states: np.ndarray,
 3                                     controls: np.ndarray,
 4                                     **kwargs) -> SimulationData:
 5    """Factory function for creating SimulationData."""
 6    return SimulationData(
 7        times=times,
 8        states=states,
 9        controls=controls,
10        reference=kwargs.get('reference'),
11        disturbances=kwargs.get('disturbances'),
12        metadata=kwargs.get('metadata', {})
13    )

create_analysis_result(status, message, data)¶

Factory function for creating AnalysisResult.

Source Code¶

 1def create_analysis_result(status: AnalysisStatus,
 2                         message: str,
 3                         data: Dict[str, Any],
 4                         **kwargs) -> AnalysisResult:
 5    """Factory function for creating AnalysisResult."""
 6    return AnalysisResult(
 7        status=status,
 8        message=message,
 9        data=data,
10        timestamp=kwargs.get('timestamp'),
11        metadata=kwargs.get('metadata')
12    )
